column4: Question: My computer is currently partitioned with 40gigs on C:, and the rest (200 gigs) on D:.  How much drive space should I allocate towards Ubuntu, if I will be using VMware to run Windows to play games?  Is 40 gigs good enough on that one partition, or should I format the whole thing and redo the partitions to allow more for Ubuntu?
Partial, I was told to get "wget -q http://download.virtualbox.org/virtualbox/debian/sun_vbox.asc -O- | sudo apt-key add -"
Seeing as most games use 3d rendering and virtual machines don't, that isn't going to work.
